meta.article_title: September 1, 2014 - How to Execute a Fast Serve

debutant.description: Serve aggressively. You can't serve fast by patting the ball over the net.

debutant.nom: First Bounce Near Your Own End-Line
debutant.description: You want to maximize the amount of table between bounces so the ball has a chance to drop. To do this you need to contact the ball far enough behind the end-line to allow this.
Otherwise the ball will bounce higher and will take longer to drop and hit the other side, and so you won't be able to serve as fast.

exercices_complementaires.nom: Targets on the Far Side of the Table
exercices_complementaires.description: Put targets on the far side of the table and see if you can consistently hit them.
exercices_complementaires.materiel: Table tennis racket, balls, and targets

metriques_progression.description: Serve fast and aim for the opponent's end-line to maximize the speed.
Aim for the middle or corners of the table to create a deep serve.

erreurs_a_eviter.description: Don't graze the ball too much with a fast serve as you won't get enough speed that way.
